definition:
To be in pain or sorrow. [Obs. or Prov. Eng. & Scot.]

Stunned. [Obs.]

1. A sudden, severe pain or grief; peril; alarm. [Obs.] Spenser. 2. Astonishment; amazement. [Obs.] Spenser. Gay.

1. Hour; time; season. [Obs.] Chaucer. 2. A brief space of time; a moment. [Obs.] Chaucer. In a stound, suddenly. [Obs.] Chaucer.

A vessel for holding small beer. [Prov. Eng.] Halliwell.
